title: Charmed, Lost Boys Reboots Pushed To Next Season
text:
Charmed, Lost Boys Reboots Pushed To Next Season Joseph Schmidt Start Photo Gallery Back to Article Image of 
The CW decided to push back the reboot of Charmed to next season, having finalized their pilot schedule for the coming year. 
With word that the network could expand their DC Universe with Black Lightning , also came the notice that they will redevelop Charmed with high hopes for the following batch of new shows. 
The series is being developed by Jennie Snyder Urman, creator of the CW’s hit series Jane the Virgin , which is in the middle of airing its third season. 
This news was accompanied by word that the reboot of the Lost Boys is also being pushed back to next season. 
Rob Thomas, executive producer of iZombie , was developing the television reboot of the Lost Boys . 
Charmed , starring Shannen Doherty, Alyssa Milano, Holly Marie Combs, and Rose McGowan, ran on the CW’s predecessor network the WB from 1998 to 2006. CBS Television Studios is producing the series, which is said to be set in 1976 with ties to the original series. 
Thomas’ version of the Lost Boys would reboot the original film starring Kiefer Sutherland, Corey Haim, and Corey Feldman. The series would ideally take place over 70 years with each season focusing on a decade, beginning in 1967 in San Francisco. 
Thomas is still producing iZombie , which wrapped production on its third season. Maybe this will free him up to work on that Veronica Mars series we've heard about . (Photo: Facebook / Charmed)
